alert.note: Alert for Clay; De Kalb; Jackson; Macon; Overton; Putnam; Smith; Trousdale; White; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 13 at 8:24PM CDT until April 13 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Overton County in Middle Tennessee... Smith County in Middle Tennessee... De Kalb County in Middle Tennessee... Jackson County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern Wilson County in Middle Tennessee... Southern Clay County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern Macon County in Middle Tennessee... East central Trousdale County in Middle Tennessee... Northwestern White County in Middle Tennessee... Putnam County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 900 PM CDT. * At 824 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles east of Hartsville to 6 miles west of Gordonsville to 8 miles south of Watertown, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Cookeville, Sparta, Smithville, Livingston, Carthage, Gainesboro, Algood, Watertown, Baxter, Gordonsville, Hickman, South Carthage, Alexandria, Dowelltown, Liberty, Auburntown, Hamptons Crossroads, Pleasant Shade, Center Hill Lake and Cummins Falls State Park. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 247 and 296. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for Middle Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for Middle Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Clay; De Kalb; Jackson; Macon; Overton; Putnam; Smith; Trousdale; White; Wilson
